page.title: 01Little Hale Fen
page.content: The landscape of this flat featureless fenland reflects the intensive agriculture of the area; any view consists mostly of sky, & the horizontality is strengthened by a line of pylons & the banks from the excavation of the man-made Forty Foot Drain. The productive large rectangular fields are without hedges: field boundaries are defined by ditches, assisted visually by differeing crop colour & texture. There are few big trees; new trees are in tidy blocks affording concentrated shelter for pheasants & partridges. The highly mechanised farming is predominantly arable; crops include cereals, sugar beet, potatoes, oil- seed rape, peas & onions; the land is heavy.
